Class LXDNSReplyRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXDNSReplyRecord

  • public class LXDNSReplyRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    LXmDNSReplyRecord holds a Reply Record Data structure

    001
    Author:
    Claude Heintz
    See Also:
    LXUPnPDelegate

    • Constructor Detail

      • LXDNSReplyRecord

        public LXDNSReplyRecord(java.lang.String n,
                        int qt,
                        int qc,
                        long ttl,
                        int p,
                        byte[] d)
        construct a LXDNSReplyRecord
        Parameters:
        n - NAME or QNAME represented as dot separated labels: webpage._http.local
        qt - QTYPE
        qc - QCLASS
        ttl - TimeToLive
        p - pointer to next record
        d - data array

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        in a DNS record, me.mycomputer.com is encoded as 0x02, 'm', 'e', 0x0A, 'm', 'y', 'c', 'o', 'm', 'p', 'u', 't', 'e', 'r', 0x03, 'c', 'o', 'm' each "label" has a length byte, followed by that number of characters when written or extracted as a string, the domain labels are concatenated with dots
        Returns:
        the NAME or QNAME of the record

      • packetID

        public int packetID()
        Reply records may belong to the question, answer, authority, or additional sections of the message. Each reply record is linked to being part of the same message by this number which is just a simple sequence count of packets.
        Returns:
        id of the packet to which this record belongs

      • setPacketID

        public void setPacketID(int i)
        Reply records may belong to the question, answer, authority, or additional sections of the message. Each reply record is linked to being part of the same message by this number which is just a simple sequence count of packets.
        Parameters:
        i - the sequence number of the packet to which this message belongs

      • getQType

        public int getQType()
        QTYPE of the record eg. A, CNAME, MX, etc.
        Returns:
        int code giving the QTYPE of the record

      • getQClass

        public int getQClass()
        QCLASS of the record, most likely 0x01, or IN, internet class
        Returns:
        ode giving the QCLASS of the record

      • getCacheFlag

        public boolean getCacheFlag()
        Returns:
        true if cache flag is set

      • getTimeToLive

        public long getTimeToLive()
        Returns:
        long time for the record to remain valid

      • getNextLocation

        public int getNextLocation()
        Returns:
        int index of next record in the bytes of the message packet

      • getAddress

        public java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
        sender's IP address should be provided for answer messages null for query messages optional for authority and additional messages
        Returns:
        INetAddress of the sender of the packet to which this record belongs

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.net.InetAddress addr)
        Parameters:
        addr - the INetAddress of the sender of the packet to which this record belongs

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
        Returns:
        array of bytes representing the data attached to this record
